fr.inria.atlanmod.commons

Class Stopwatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.inria.atlanmod.commons.Stopwatch

  • @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public final class Stopwatch
extends java.lang.Object
    An object that measures elapsed time using Instant.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static Stopwatch createStarted()
      Creates (and starts) a new stopwatch.
      static Stopwatch createUnstarted()
      Creates (but does not start) a new stopwatch.
      java.time.Duration elapsed()
      Returns the current elapsed time shown on this stopwatch.
      boolean isRunning()
      Checks whether this stopwatch is currently running.
      Stopwatch reset()
      Sets the elapsed time for this stopwatch to 0, and places it in a stopped state.
      Stopwatch start()
      Starts this stopwatch.
      Stopwatch stop()
      Stops this stopwatch.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • createUnstarted

        @Nonnull
public static Stopwatch createUnstarted()
        Creates (but does not start) a new stopwatch.
        Returns:
        a new stopwatch

      • createStarted

        @Nonnull
public static Stopwatch createStarted()
        Creates (and starts) a new stopwatch.
        Returns:
        a new stopwatch

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        Checks whether this stopwatch is currently running.
        Returns:
        true if start() has been called, and stop() has been not called since the last call to start()

      • start

        @Nonnull
public Stopwatch start()
        Starts this stopwatch.
        Returns:
        this stopwatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this stopwatch is already running

      • stop

        @Nonnull
public Stopwatch stop()
        Stops this stopwatch.
        Returns:
        this stopwatch
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if this stopwatch is already stopped

      • reset

        @Nonnull
public Stopwatch reset()
        Sets the elapsed time for this stopwatch to 0, and places it in a stopped state.
        Returns:
        this stopwatch

      • elapsed

        @Nonnull
public java.time.Duration elapsed()
        Returns the current elapsed time shown on this stopwatch. If this stopwatch is currently running, the duration is processed according to the starting point until now.
        Returns:
        the duration
